English:
Hey you! What's up?
Walking? Flirting? Investigating?
Chinese: Hey You！你在做什麼？散步？搭訕？調查事件？
Korean: 헤이유~! 뭐하고 있어? 산책? 헌팅? 사건 조사?
German:
He, du! Was ist angesagt?
Spazierengehen? Flirten? Ermitteln?

English:
Me, I'm just waiting for something to happen.
On alert! Locked and ready!
Chinese:
我是……就那個啦！為了能應付突發狀況，
我才會像這樣在這裡待命……之類的？
Korean:
난 그거야, 그거! 무슨 일이 일어났을 때를 위해
여기서 이렇게 대기하고 있다…같은 느낌?
German:
Ich warte nur darauf, dass etwas passiert.
Ich bin in Alarmbereitschaft!
Geladen und bereit!

English:
If there's trouble, just call Akkino...right?
Right! That's what I'm talking 'bout!
Chinese:
像是有困難找雅奇諾小姐就對了！……之類的？
總之就是那種感覺啦！
Korean:
곤란할 때를 위한 앗키노 씨…같이?
이른바 하나의, 그런 느낌이야!
German:
Ruf einfach Akkino, wenn es Ärger gibt, okay?
Jawohl! Das meine ich doch!

English:
Hm? What's up? Is there some burning
question you desperately need to ask me?
Chinese:
咦？　你是怎麼了？
……咦！？　你有件想認真跟我談談的事？
Korean:
어라? 무슨 일 있어?
…후엣!? 나에게 긴히 묻고 싶은 일이라도?
German:
Hm? Was ist los? Hast du eine Frage, die du
unbedingt loswerden musst?

English: What!? Spill it, what's the deal?
Chinese: 咦！？　什麼什麼，你怎麼了？
German: Was?! Na los, raus damit, was ist denn los?

English:
If you've found your special someone,
then hurry up and introduce them to me!
You know I'm rooting for you all the way!
Chinese:
如果你有認識特別的對象，
你也要好好介紹給我認識哦！
我會全力支援你的☆
Korean:
혹시 특별한 사람이 생기면
나한테 똑~바로 소개하도록 해!
잔~뜩 응원해줄테니까♡
German:
Wenn du endlich jemanden kennengelernt hast, dann
stell uns doch gefälligst einander vor! Du weißt,
ich würde es dir wirklich gönnen.
